verbs.description: monarchize (third-person singular simple present monarchizes, present participle monarchizing, simple past and past participle monarchized)

examples: For, should we giue this Empresse but her due,
We must confesse, she can all Soules subdue,
to Passions causing Ioy, or forcing Teares.
[…]  so far we shall be from mending our condition by monarchizing our government, whatever new conceit now possesses us.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To act or play the part of a monarch.
examples: Uice hath golden cheekes, O pittie, pittie,
She in euery land doth monarchize.
Uertue is exilde from euery Cittie,
Uertue is a foole, Uice onely wise.
